Description: Marl pottery jar of squat globular shape, with rounded base, flat ledge rim and two tubular handles on the shoulder. The exterior is decorated in red paint with wavy lines running diagonally on the upper half of the vessel, horizontal bands of wavy lines and z-motifs are placed at the maximum diameter. Perpendicular bands of wavy lines and z-motifs run across the lower body and base.
Curator's comments: Like Decorated ware D9c in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery.
